instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.

threads.title: 00165 weird voltage
threads.message: Have a 000165 with widespread liquid damage. The wierd thing is when i use a new I/O board, it shows the "battery voltage low" screen (battery with red and the lightning bolt). I tried two other known good ones and same thing. I change back to the damaged original and it doesnt happen.  Obviously this is not right. I have been probing around the <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> area and see that on pin 1 of <CAPACITOR>C7090</CAPACITOR>, or also pin 3 of <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>, it reads 7.02 volts... this seems like an odd voltage given it is <SIGNAL>P3V42G3H_BOOST</SIGNAL>. also, DCIN reads 20V. the resistors in that area really check out fine. Ideas?

threads.title: 00165 weird voltage
threads.message: I would start with reporting PPBUS and 3V42 voltages. Also is green/orange light present?
